pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1968–69)

rows.text: Copilot of RA-3B #144847 hit by ground fire on a night photo-reconnaissance mission
Senior Chief Photographer on RA-3B #144847 hit by ground fire on a night photo-reconnaissance mission
Believed to have been killed when an ammunition bunker exploded during a mortar attack on LZ Leslie
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared during the evacuation following an ambush in the Que Son Valley

Pilot of RF-4C that crashed on a reconnaissance mission, the wreckage was located in steep terrain but the bodies of the crew could not be recovered due to enemy presence. In 2006 the remains of the copilot 1LT Charles Bifolchi were identified
Pilot of F-4D #66-8729 shot down on a night interdiction mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-8729 shot down on a night interdiction mission
Gunner on UH-1C gunship #66-00745 hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned. SAR forces recovered the burnt remains of three crewmen only one of whom could be identified.
Aircraft commander of UH-1C gunship #66-00745 hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned
Pilot of UH-1C gunship #66-00745 hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Seriously wounded and captured in battle
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Disappeared when his team was ambushed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on C-1A #146054 that ditched on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of C-1A #146054 that ditched on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of EF-10B that crashed at sea
Pilot of an F-4B that crashed at sea while investigating a surface contact
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar intercept officer on an F-4B that crashed at sea while investigating a surface contact
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an F-4C shot down on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Weapons system officer on an F-4C shot down on a night armed reconnaissance mission

Door gunner on a UH-1D that landed to assist the evacuation of a downed helicopter, he was left behind when his helicopter departed the area due to enemy fire and his body was observed several days later
Gunner on a UH-1D that was shot down while inserting ARVN troops east of Khe Sanh
Copilot of A-6A #152932 that crashed at sea, the pilot CDR L S Kollmorgen ejected successfully
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Captured by Vietcong after his house was surrounded and his wife was killed. Last seen alive in May 1968
Disappeared in a jeep in the southern outskirts of Saigon. His passenger SP4 William Behren's body was recovered 4 days later
Missionary/nurse captured by Vietcong from the Buôn Ma Thuột leprosarium. Died of disease/malnutrition on 1 February 1969
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Passenger on UH-1H #66-16442 that crashed on a flight from Quang Tri Province to Chu Lai. The burnt wreckage of the helicopter was located in May 1968 and some remains were recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #66-16442 that crashed on a flight from Quang Tri Province to Chu Lai
Crew chief on UH-1H #66-16442 that crashed on a flight from Quang Tri Province to Chu Lai
Passenger on UH-1H #66-16442 that crashed on a flight from Quang Tri Province to Chu Lai
Passenger on UH-1H #66-16442 that crashed on a flight from Quang Tri Province to Chu Lai
Driver of an armored personnel carrier which was hit by a rocket propelled grenade, caught fire, and exploded. No identifiable remains were recovered from the wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
Died in captivity, remains not returned

Pilot of an RF-4C #66-0443 that crashed into the ground on a photo-reconnaissance mission. No ejections observed. The remains of the copilot 1LT Robert John Edgar were returned in May 1997 and identified in April 2009
Senior chief aviation anti-submarine warfare man
Killed in action, body not recovered
Aviation anti-submarine warfare technician on P-3B #153440 that crashed at sea on a 24 hour surveillance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered
Aviation mechanic reciprocating on P-3B #153440 that crashed at sea on a 24 hour surveillance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Aviation electrician on P-3B #153440 that crashed at sea on a 24 hour surveillance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on P-3B #153440 that crashed at sea on a 24 hour surveillance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Wounded in the battle and last seen trying to evade NVA troops
Passenger on UH-1D #64-13894 that was shot down, he was severely burnt while trying to retrieve his rifle from the wreck, he was captured by Viet Cong and believed to have been executed
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Medic on UH-1H #66-17027 that crashed on a night medevac mission to the Gia Nghĩa special forces camp
Crew chief on UH-1H #66-17027 that crashed on a night medevac mission
Pilot of UH-1H #66-17027 that crashed on a night medevac mission
Aircraft commander of UH-1H #66-17027 that crashed on a night medevac mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on RF-4C lost on a daytime photo-reconnaissance mission. The remains of the pilot LTC Gilbert Palmer were identified in May 2011
Pilot of A-6A #152938 hit by enemy fire and crashed at sea
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #152938 hit by enemy fire and crashed at sea
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #152944 hit by enemy fire after a night attack near Haiphong
Pilot of A-6A #152944 hit by enemy fire after a night attack near Haiphong
Crew chief on a CH-46A that ditched at sea following a maintenance test flight from the USS Valley Forge (CV-45)
Killed in action, body not recovered
Bombardier/navigator on an A-6A shot down on a night attack mission. The remains of the pilot Lt. Richard C. Nelson were returned in 1984
Commander of USAF personnel at the facility. Disappeared during the battle. Listed as killed in action, body not recovered, his remains were recovered and subsequently identified in September 2012
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-37A was hit by ground fire during a close air support mission and crashed. SAR forces secured the area shortly after the crash but were unable to locate any remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Wounded in an ambush and captured, he was reported to have died from his wounds the following day
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #152943 that ditched on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of A-6A # 152943that ditched on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Rifleman killed during a battle in the village of Lam Xuan
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Passenger on a UH-1H #67-17254 shot down on a flight from Phu Bai to Camp Evans. All passengers and crew survived the crash and split into 2 5-man teams, one to stay at the crash site and the other to walk to Camp Evans. The crash site team was attacked by Vietcong and all were killed, the remains of 2 other members of the team were located 15 days later
Passenger on UH-1H #67-17254 shot down on a flight from Phu Bai to Camp Evans, killed during a Vietcong attack on the crash site
Copilot of UH-1H #67-17254 shot down on a flight from Phu Bai to Camp Evans, killed during a Vietcong attack on the crash site
Pilot of F-4D shot down on a close air support mission, both crewmen successfully ejected and he directed airstrikes on enemy positions before radio contact ceased
Disappeared while inspecting a river bank
Disappeared while inspecting a river bank
Reciprocating engine mechanic on an S-2E that disappeared on a night anti-submarine patrol, some aircraft wreckage was receovered 4 days later
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of an S-2E that disappeared on a night anti-submarine patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an S-2E that disappeared on a night anti-submarine patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
ASW technician on an S-2E that disappeared on a night anti-submarine patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D #61-0162 was hit by enemy fire and crashed
Captured by Vietcong while on a road-clearing operation. Died of malnutrition and disease in November 1969
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Drowned in the Quang Ngai River while trying to assist Vietnamese civilians
Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer/radio operator on O-1G #51-4899 that disappeared on a visual reconnaissance mission. The remains of the pilot Major Charles E. Blair were returned in April 1988
Pilot of an F-4D hit by ground fire, no ejection observed
Weapons system operator on an F-4D hit by ground fire, no ejection observed
Weapons system operator on an F-4C #64-0830 hit by enemy fire. The pilot Colonel Theodore W. Guy ejected and was captured, he did not believe that Lyon had ejected in time
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of OV-1C #603756 that crashed into the Hậu Giang River while manoevuring at low level
Killed in action, body not recovered

Commanding officer of HMM-363, he was wounded during a mortar attack on Phu Bai airbase he was being evacuated on UH-34D #144654 of HMM-363 that crashed at sea in bad weather north of Danang. Both pilots were rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Medical evacuee on a UH-34D #144654 that crashed at sea in bad weather north of Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crew chief on a UH-34D #144654 that crashed at sea in bad weather north of Danang.
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner on a UH-34D #144654 that crashed at sea in bad weather north of Danang.
Killed in action, body not recovered
Medical evacuee on a UH-34D #144654 that crashed at sea in bad weather north of Danang.
Killed in action, body not recovered
Rifleman setting demolition charges in an enemy bunker complex, killed when the charges detonated prematurely
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on an F-4D #66‑8801 that was shot down and exploded on impact while on a daylight bombing mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑8801 that was shot down
Killed in action, body not recovered

Team leader of a reconnaissance team that was operating in the A Shau Valley. The team was attacked while awaiting extraction, he was providing covering fire for the team when he was seen to be shot several times and was

Member of a US/ARVN reconnaissance team that was engaged by the enemy. As the team was being by rope ladder from a hovering helicopter, the ladder broke and he fell to the ground with the 2 other Americans in the team. SAR forces searched the area 3 days later but were unable to find any trace of him or the other 2 missing Americans. The remains of the team leader, SFC George R Brown were identified in 2006
Member of a US/ARVN reconnaissance team that was engaged by the enemy, he was unable to be extracted
Pilot of F-111A #66-0022 lost on a night bombing mission.
Shot and wounded in an ambush, he was left behind when his unit withdrew and could not be recovered
Shot in the head and confirmed to be dead during an assault, his body was left behind and could not be recovered

Pilot of an O-1D shot down on a visual reconnaissance mission. His observer SGT William B. Taylor was captured, subsequently escaped from a Vietcong POW camp and was rescued by a US Army helicopter on 6 May
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an RF-4C that crashed at sea after bomb damage assessment mission. On 11 April the remains of the weapons system operator Capt. John C. Hardy were recovered from the sea
Passenger on a Navy troop carrier making a river assault, he was killed by enemy fire and his body was left behind during the withdrawal
Killed in action, body not recovered
His unit was ambushed on patrol and he took shelter in a bomb crater which received a direct hit from a mortar round, no identifiable remains were recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His unit was ambushed on patrol and he took shelter in a bomb crater which received a direct hit from a mortar round, no identifiable remains were recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by friendly fire from a fire support mission for his reconnaissance patrol. His remains were placed in a body bag, which fell from a helicopter during evacuation
Killed in action, body not recovered
member of an airboat patrol that was ambushed by enemy forces, he was severely wounded and disappeared when the boat capsized
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on a UH-34 that crashed while flying from Danang to Kham Duc, his remains could not be identified among the burnt wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-37A was hit by ground fire and he ejected successfully. SAR forces located his empty parachute in trees shortly after the crash
A Company, 228th Assault Support Helicopter Battalion
Crewman on CH-47A #64-13124 hit by enemy fire and crashed on approach to LZ Tiger
A Company, 228th Assault Support Helicopter Battalion
Flight engineer on CH-47A #64-13124 hit by enemy fire and crashed
A Company, 228th Assault Support Helicopter Battalion
Crew chief on CH-47A #64-13124 hit by enemy fire and crashed
B Company, 228th Assault Support Helicopter Battalion
Flight engineer on CH-47A #66-19063 hit by enemy fire and crashed on approach to LZ Tiger, he jumped from the helicopter before its crashed
B Company, 228th Assault Support Helicopter Battalion
Crew chief on CH-47A #66-19063hit by enemy fire, he jumped from the helicopter before it crashed
Passenger on a UH-1D on an air assault mission, the helicopter was hit by enemy fire and began to spin throwing him out of the helicopter at an altitude of 3–4000ft
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1E #152346 hit by enemy fire and crashed. SAR forces recovered the body of Corporal Cecil Parsons and partial remains from the wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of UH-1E #152346 hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner on UH-1E #152346 hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered

Passenger on UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel. The helicopter apparently exploded in midair, wreckage was located on 26 May but no recovery effort could be mounted due to strong enemy presence
Gunner on UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel
Crew chief on UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel
Copilot of UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel
Passenger on UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel
Pilot of UH-1H #66-16209 shot down while on a recovery mission to LZ Veghel
Killed when a 122mm round ignited the Company's ammunition supplies which had been gathered for removal, no identifiable remains recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑8778 that crashed after making a bombing run
Killed in action, body not recovered
Bombardier/naviagtor on F-4D #66‑8778 that crashed after making a bombing run
Killed in action, body not recovered
On exchange duty from the Navy he was piloting F-111A #66-024 that disappeared on a solo night bombing mission
Copilot of F-111A #66-024 that disappeared on a solo night bombing mission
Weapons systems operator on F-4D #66-8736 shot down after attacking a SAM site.
Pilot of F-4D #66-8736 shot down after attacking a SAM site
Killed when his Company was ambushed on a patrol near LZ Tiger, his body could not be recovered due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when his Company was ambushed on a patrol near LZ Tiger, his body could not be recovered due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when his Company was ambushed on a patrol near LZ Tiger, his body could not be recovered due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of C-130B #60-0298 hit by enemy fire while on approach to A Luoi airfield, the aircraft crashed and burnt on the airfield
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on C-130B #60-0298 hit by enemy fire while on approach to A Luoi airfield, the aircraft crashed and burnt on the airfield
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of RF-4C #66-0398 that disappeared on a daytime photo-reconnaissance mission
Pilot of RF-4C #66-0398 that disappeared on a daytime photo-reconnaissance mission
His A-4E # 151070 crashed while on a strafing run during a night interdiction mission, no ejection observed
Copilot of A-26A lost on a night interdiction mission
Presumptive finding of death until 28 May 2013 when his remains were identified
Pilot of A-26A lost on a night interdiction mission
Presumptive finding of death until 31 May 2013 when his remains were identified
Disappeared during an attack on NVA positions near Cam Vu
Gunner on OH-6A that crashed on a low-level visual reconnaissance mission. SAR forces were unable to approach the crash due to strong enemy presence
Crew chief on OH-6A that crashed on a low-level visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of OH-6A that crashed on a low-level visual reconnaissance mission
Detachment A-109 (Thuong Duc), 5th Special Forces Group
Adviser to a CIDG unit that encountered an entrenched NVA position, he was shot multiple times and left behind when the unit withdrew
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #154164 that was shot down on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Pilot of A-6A #154164 that was shot down on a night armed reconnaissance mission
His F-8E was hit by ground fire, crashed and burned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radio operator on a maintenance boat, lost overboard during night watch

Medic/radio operator on a 9-man reconnaissance mission that engaged in a running battle with NVA forces, he was shot dead when his team took defensive positions. Only one team member SSgt John Allen survived the battle and was extracted the following day
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1C #64-14172 that exploded in midair on a combat support mission. Unidentifiable remains of 4 bodies were located 4 days later but could not be recovered due to enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Aircraft commander on UH-1C #64-14172 that exploded in midair on a combat support mission
Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered
Crew chief on UH-1C #64-14172 that exploded in midair on a combat support mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Shot in the head during an ambush, his body was left behind due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared during the withdrawal from Ngok Tavak
Disappeared when NVA troops overran his bunker position on OP1
Shot multiple times as he withdrew from bunker position on OP1, his body was unable to be recovered due to enemy fire
Killed by enemy mortar fire, his body was left behind during the evacuation
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on a CH-47 #67-18475, he was killed by enemy fire. The helicopter crash-landed on the runway, his body was examined but could not be removed before the helicopter caught fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Died of wounds as he attempted to evade capture after being left behind when the base was evacuated
Killed by enemy fire as the NVA overran his bunker position on OP2
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by enemy fire as the NVA overran his bunker position on OP2
Killed in action, body not recovered

Disappeared when NVA forces overran his bunker position on OP2
Lost overboard while returning from shore leave to his ship moored in the Bassac River

Pilot of an F-4D shot down on an armed reconnaissance mission, no ejection observed
Disappeared when his night boat patrol was ambushed
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #66-0442 hit by enemy fire on a daytime photo-reconnaissance mission near Dong Hoi. The pilot Capt Terry J Uyeyama ejected successfully and was captured
Died from multiple mortar wounds while on a reconnaissance patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D lost on a night armed reconnaissance mission. The remains of the weapons system operator 1LT Glenn D McCubbin were returned in January 1989
Pilot of F-4D #66-0246 hit by enemy fire and exploded on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-0246 hit by enemy fire and exploded on a night armed reconnaissance mission

Rifleman on a reconnaissance patrol that was ambushed, his body was left behind when the team evacuated
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D #0409 was shot down and crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Wounded in an ambush he disappeared when he moved from a temporary aid station to the landing zone for medical evacuation
Pilot of F-4J #155554 hit by enemy fire and headed out to sea, the radar intercept officer LTjg William A. Simmons ejected successfully, but Lt Brice's canopy failed to jettison
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of F-4 #66-8724 that flew into terrain on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Disappeared while on a bomb damage assessment patrol
Disappeared while on a night ambush
His A-1H was hit by enemy fire while on an SAR mission and crashed, no ejection observed
His patrol was ambushed and he was killed, his body was left behind as his Company withdrew
Killed in action, body not recovered
Shot and killed while on patrol on Hill 881-South. His body could not be recovered due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #150650 hit by ground fire and crashed on a close air support mission, no ejection observed

Stepped on a mine during a road-clearing operation, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-100D #56-2905 hit by ground fire while attacking an anti-aircraft position, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared while returning to his observation post near the Tu Cau bridge
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑7682 hit by enemy fire on a night armed reconnaissance mission and crashed inverted into the sea
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7682 hit by enemy fire on a night armed reconnaissance mission and crashed inverted into the sea
Pilot of F-4J #155540 that was hit by enemy fire and exploded in midair on a daytime armed reconnaissance mission. The radar intercept officer Lt. Robert S. Fant ejected successfully and was captured
His A-4F 154182 was shot down on a night road reconnaissance mission
Drowned while returning to his ship anchored on the My Tho River
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by a command detonated mine, no remains recoverable
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner on UH-1C #66-15154 that crashed in bad weather. The wreckage was located on 6 August 1971 and partial remains of the pilot WO W Fernan were recovered
Pilot of UH-1C #66-15154 that crashed in bad weather
Crew chief on UH-1C #66-15154 that crashed in bad weather

Pilot of F-4D #66‑8822 that crashed on on a night armed reconnaissance mission
His A-1H spun out of control and crashed, no ejection observed

Pilot of RF-4C #66-0447 shot down on a photo-reconnaissance mission. Both crewmen ejected successfully and he was apparently shot while evading capture. The copilot Capt. Joseph F. Shanahan was captured
Copilot of F-100F #56-3865 lost on a Misty FAC mission
Killed by sniper fire during an ambush, his body was left behind when his unit withdrew
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared in a mine explosion while assisting in the rescue of the crew of a downed helicopter
Killed in action, body not recovered

Passenger on a VAP-61 RA-3B on an R&R flight to Bangkok. The RA-3B went out of control at 25,000ft and the 3 passengers bailed out. Only two chutes were observed and two men were recovered. At 10,000ft the pilot recovered control of the RA-3B and flew it back to DaNang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared when his unit was ambushed while on patrol in the Ben Cui Rubber Plantation
Weapons system operator on an RF-4C #66‑0466 that disappeared on a night photo-reconnaissance mission
Pilot of RF-4C #66‑0466 that disappeared on a night photo-reconnaissance mission
Disappeared during an ambush, captured by the Vietcong he was shot while trying to excape in May 1970
Died in captivity, remains not returned
His F-4B #150434 ditched after launch, the radar intercept officer Lt j.g. T.L. McPherson was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system officer on F-4D #66‑8694 that crashed while making an attack during a night strike and armed reconnaissance mission, no ejection observed
Pilot of F-4D #66‑8694 that crashed while on a night strike and armed reconnaissance mission
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7531 which was hit by ground fire and crashed at sea, the weapons system officer 1Lt Samuel F Wilburn ejected successfully

Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑8688 hit by ground fire on a night armed reconnaissance mission. The pilot CPT J Wilson ejected successfully and was rescued
Door gunner on UH-1C #66-66613 hit by ground fire, crashed and exploded on impact. The remains of the other crewmembers were recovered by SAR forces
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an O-1F that disappeared
Captured by Vietcong while off duty. Last seen alive in Svay Rieng Province, Cambodia in January 1969

Shot and wounded during an ambush, his unit withdrew leaving him behind. When US forces returned to the area they were unable to locate his body and the Vietcong later reported that he was captured and died from his wounds
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #65‑0915 that was shot down on a photo-reconnaissance mission. The pilot Capt l.L. Paul ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Drowned while swimming in the Cua Viet River
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared during the explosion and fire aboard an LCM-6
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4E #152091 crashed into the rear of the carrier while on a landing approach, dropped into the sea and sank
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1H #52-135305 was hit by enemy fire on an attack run, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared when the APC he was riding on top of was hit by an enemy rocket causing mines and grenades to explode
Pilot of F-105F #63-8317 shot down on a Wild Weasel mission
Weapons system operator on F-105F #63-8317 shot down on a Wild Weasel mission
Navigator/bombardier on A-6A #154149 hit by a SAM while on a night armed reconnaissance mission. The remains of the pilot Lieutenant j.g. Larry J. VanRenselaar were returned in 1989
Team leader of RT Alabama, killed by enemy fire shortly after insertion on a reconnaissance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered
Wounded during an ambush he was left behind when his unit withdrew and the area was subsequently targeted with artillery fire and air support

Shot during an ambush he was left behind as his unit withdrew
